templates.name: Kubernetes cluster state by HTTP
templates.description:
Get Kubernetes state metrics by HTTP.
Metrics are collected by requests to Kubernetes API.

Don't forget to read the README.md for the correct setup of the template.

You can discuss this template or leave feedback on our forum https://www.zabbix.com/forum/zabbix-suggestions-and-feedback

Generated by official Zabbix template tool "Templator"

items.name: Control plane LLD
items.description: Generation of data for Control plane discovery rules.

items.name: Job count
items.description: Number of jobs (generated by cronjob + job).

items.name: Node LLD
items.description: Generation of data for Kubelet discovery rules.

items.name: Get state metrics

item_prototypes.name: Component [{#NAME}]: Healthy
item_prototypes.description: Cluster component healthy.

trigger_prototypes.expression: count(/Kubernetes cluster state by HTTP/kube.componentstatuses.healthy[{#NAME}],#3,,"True")<2 and length(last(/Kubernetes cluster state by HTTP/kube.componentstatuses.healthy[{#NAME}]))>0
trigger_prototypes.name: Component [{#NAME}] is unhealthy

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] CronJob [{#NAME}]: Completion failed
item_prototypes.description: Number of jobs the execution of which has failed.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] CronJob [{#NAME}]: Completion succeeded
item_prototypes.description: Number of jobs the execution of which has been completed.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] CronJob [{#NAME}]: Last schedule
item_prototypes.description: LastScheduleTime keeps information of when was the last time the job was successfully scheduled.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] CronJob [{#NAME}]: Next schedule
item_prototypes.description: Next time the cronjob should be scheduled. The time after lastScheduleTime or after the cron job's creation time if it's never been scheduled. Use this to determine if the job is delayed.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] CronJob [{#NAME}]: Suspend
item_prototypes.description: Suspend flag tells the controller to suspend subsequent executions.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] CronJob [{#NAME}]: Active
item_prototypes.description: Active holds pointers to currently running jobs.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] CronJob [{#NAME}]: Failed
item_prototypes.description: The number of pods which reached the Failed phase and the reason for failure.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] CronJob [{#NAME}]: Succeeded
item_prototypes.description: The number of pods which reached the Succeeded phase.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Daemonset [{#NAME}]: Desired
item_prototypes.description: The number of nodes that should be running the daemon pod.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Daemonset [{#NAME}]: Misscheduled
item_prototypes.description: The number of nodes that run a daemon pod but are not supposed to.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Daemonset [{#NAME}]: Ready
item_prototypes.description: The number of nodes that should be running the daemon pod and have one or more running and ready.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Daemonset [{#NAME}]: Scheduled
item_prototypes.description: The number of nodes that run at least one daemon pod and are supposed to.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Daemonset [{#NAME}]: Updated number scheduled
item_prototypes.description: The total number of nodes that are running updated daemon pod.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Deployment [{#NAME}]: Replicas
item_prototypes.description: The number of replicas per deployment.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Deployment [{#NAME}]: Replicas available
item_prototypes.description: The number of available replicas per deployment.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Deployment [{#NAME}]: Replicas desired
item_prototypes.description: Number of desired pods for a deployment.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Deployment [{#NAME}]: Replicas mismatched
item_prototypes.description: The number of available replicas not matching the desired number of replicas.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Deployment [{#NAME}]: Replicas unavailable
item_prototypes.description: The number of unavailable replicas per deployment.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Deployment [{#NAME}]: Replicas updated
item_prototypes.description: The number of updated replicas per deployment.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Deployment [{#NAME}]: Rollingupdate max unavailable
item_prototypes.description: Maximum number of unavailable replicas during a rolling update of a deployment.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Deployment [{#NAME}]: Paused
item_prototypes.description: Whether the deployment is paused and will not be processed by the deployment controller.

trigger_prototypes.expression:
min(/Kubernetes cluster state by HTTP/kube.deployment.replicas_mismatched[{#NAMESPACE}/{#NAME}],{$KUBE.REPLICA.MISMATCH.EVAL_PERIOD:"deployment:{#NAMESPACE}:{#NAME}"})>0
and last(/Kubernetes cluster state by HTTP/kube.deployment.replicas_desired[{#NAMESPACE}/{#NAME}])>=0
and last(/Kubernetes cluster state by HTTP/kube.deployment.replicas_available[{#NAMESPACE}/{#NAME}])>=0
trigger_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Deployment [{#NAME}]: Deployment replicas mismatch
trigger_prototypes.description: Deployment has not matched the expected number of replicas during the specified trigger evaluation period.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Endpoint [{#NAME}]: Address available
item_prototypes.description: Number of addresses available in endpoint.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Endpoint [{#NAME}]: Address not ready
item_prototypes.description: Number of addresses not ready in endpoint.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Endpoint [{#NAME}]: Age
item_prototypes.description: Endpoint age (number of seconds since creation).

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Job [{#NAME}]: Completion failed
item_prototypes.description: Number of jobs the execution of which has failed.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Job [{#NAME}]: Completion succeeded
item_prototypes.description: Number of jobs the execution of which has been completed.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Job [{#NAME}]: Failed
item_prototypes.description: The number of pods which reached the Failed phase and the reason for failure.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Job [{#NAME}]: Succeeded
item_prototypes.description: The number of pods which reached the Succeeded phase.

item_prototypes.name: Livez [{#NAME}]: Healthcheck
item_prototypes.description: Result of livez healthcheck for component.

trigger_prototypes.expression: count(/Kubernetes cluster state by HTTP/kube.livez.healthcheck[{#NAME}],#3,,"ok")<2 and length(last(/Kubernetes cluster state by HTTP/kube.livez.healthcheck[{#NAME}]))>0
trigger_prototypes.name: Livez [{#NAME}] is unhealthy

item_prototypes.name: Node [{#NAME}]: CPU allocatable
item_prototypes.description: The CPU resources of a node that are available for scheduling.

item_prototypes.name: Node [{#NAME}]: CPU capacity
item_prototypes.description: The capacity for CPU resources of a node.

item_prototypes.name: Node [{#NAME}]: Ephemeral storage allocatable
item_prototypes.description: The allocatable ephemeral storage of a node that is available for scheduling.

item_prototypes.name: Node [{#NAME}]: Ephemeral storage capacity
item_prototypes.description: The ephemeral storage capacity of a node.

item_prototypes.name: Node [{#NAME}]: Memory allocatable
item_prototypes.description: The memory resources of a node that are available for scheduling.

item_prototypes.name: Node [{#NAME}]: Memory capacity
item_prototypes.description: The capacity for memory resources of a node.

item_prototypes.name: Node [{#NAME}]: Pods allocatable
item_prototypes.description: The pods resources of a node that are available for scheduling.

item_prototypes.name: Node [{#NAME}]: Pods capacity
item_prototypes.description: The capacity for pods resources of a node.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] PodDisruptionBudget [{#NAME}]: Disruptions allowed
item_prototypes.description: Number of pod disruptions that are allowed.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] PodDisruptionBudget [{#NAME}]: Pods desired
item_prototypes.description: Minimum desired number of healthy pods.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] PodDisruptionBudget [{#NAME}]: Pods healthy
item_prototypes.description: Current number of healthy pods.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] PodDisruptionBudget [{#NAME}]: Pods total
item_prototypes.description: Total number of pods counted by this disruption budget.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Pod [{#NAME}]: Containers CPU limits
item_prototypes.description: The limit on CPU cores to be used by a container.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Pod [{#NAME}]: Containers memory limits
item_prototypes.description: The limit on memory to be used by a container.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Pod [{#NAME}]: Containers CPU requests
item_prototypes.description: The number of requested CPU cores by a container.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Pod [{#NAME}]: Containers memory requests
item_prototypes.description: The number of requested memory bytes by a container.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Pod [{#NAME}]: Containers ready
item_prototypes.description: Describes whether the containers readiness check succeeded.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Pod [{#NAME}]: Containers restarts
item_prototypes.description: The number of container restarts.

trigger_prototypes.expression: (last(/Kubernetes cluster state by HTTP/kube.pod.containers_restarts[{#NAMESPACE}/{#NAME}])-min(/Kubernetes cluster state by HTTP/kube.pod.containers_restarts[{#NAMESPACE}/{#NAME}],15m))>1
trigger_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Pod [{#NAME}]: Pod is crash looping
trigger_prototypes.description: Containers of the pod keep restarting. This most likely indicates that the pod is in the CrashLoopBackOff state.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Pod [{#NAME}]: Containers running
item_prototypes.description: Describes whether the container is currently in running state.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Pod [{#NAME}]: Containers terminated
item_prototypes.description: Describes whether the container is currently in terminated state.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Pod [{#NAME}]: Containers waiting
item_prototypes.description: Describes whether the container is currently in waiting state.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Pod [{#NAME}] Phase: Failed
item_prototypes.description: Pod is in failed state.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Pod [{#NAME}] Phase: Pending
item_prototypes.description: Pod is in pending state.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Pod [{#NAME}] Phase: Running
item_prototypes.description: Pod is in unknown state.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Pod [{#NAME}] Phase: Succeeded
item_prototypes.description: Pod is in succeeded state.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Pod [{#NAME}] Phase: Unknown
item_prototypes.description: Pod is in unknown state.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Pod [{#NAME}]: Ready
item_prototypes.description: Describes whether the pod is ready to serve requests.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Pod [{#NAME}]: Scheduled
item_prototypes.description: Describes the status of the scheduling process for the pod.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Pod [{#NAME}]: Unschedulable
item_prototypes.description: Describes the unschedulable status for the pod.

trigger_prototypes.expression: min(/Kubernetes cluster state by HTTP/kube.pod.phase.failed[{#NAMESPACE}/{#NAME}],10m)>0 or min(/Kubernetes cluster state by HTTP/kube.pod.phase.pending[{#NAMESPACE}/{#NAME}],10m)>0 or min(/Kubernetes cluster state by HTTP/kube.pod.phase.unknown[{#NAMESPACE}/{#NAME}],10m)>0
trigger_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Pod [{#NAME}]: Pod is not healthy

item_prototypes.name: PV [{#NAME}] Capacity bytes
item_prototypes.description: A capacity of the persistent volume in bytes.

item_prototypes.name: PV status phase: Available, sum
item_prototypes.description: The total amount of persistent volumes in the Available phase.

item_prototypes.name: PV status phase: Bound, sum
item_prototypes.description: The total amount of persistent volumes in the Bound phase.

item_prototypes.name: PV status phase: Failed, sum
item_prototypes.description: The total amount of persistent volumes in the Failed phase.

item_prototypes.name: PV status phase: Pending, sum
item_prototypes.description: The total amount of persistent volumes in the Pending phase.

item_prototypes.name: PV status phase: Released, sum
item_prototypes.description: The total amount of persistent volumes in the Released phase.

item_prototypes.name: PV [{#NAME}] Status phase
item_prototypes.description: The current status phase of the persistent volume.

parameters: return ['Available', 'Bound', 'Failed', 'Lost', 'Pending', 'Released'].indexOf(value) + 1 || 'Problem with status processing in JS, no such PV status: ' + value;

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] PVC [{#NAME}] Requested storage
item_prototypes.description: The capacity of storage requested by the persistent volume claim.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] PVC status phase: Bound, sum
item_prototypes.description: The total amount of persistent volume claims in the Bound phase.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] PVC status phase: Lost, sum
item_prototypes.description: The total amount of persistent volume claims in the Lost phase.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] PVC status phase: Pending, sum
item_prototypes.description: The total amount of persistent volume claims in the Pending phase.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] PVC [{#NAME}] Status phase
item_prototypes.description: The current status phase of the persistent volume claim.

parameters: return ['Available', 'Bound', 'Failed', 'Lost', 'Pending', 'Released'].indexOf(value) + 1 || 'Problem with status processing in JS, no such PVC status: ' + value;

item_prototypes.name: Readyz [{#NAME}]: Healthcheck
item_prototypes.description: Result of readyz healthcheck for component.

trigger_prototypes.expression: count(/Kubernetes cluster state by HTTP/kube.readyz.healthcheck[{#NAME}],#3,,"ok")<2 and length(last(/Kubernetes cluster state by HTTP/kube.readyz.healthcheck[{#NAME}]))>0
trigger_prototypes.name: Readyz [{#NAME}] is unhealthy

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] ReplicaSet [{#NAME}]: Fully labeled replicas
item_prototypes.description: The number of fully labeled replicas per ReplicaSet.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] ReplicaSet [{#NAME}]: Ready
item_prototypes.description: The number of ready replicas per ReplicaSet.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] ReplicaSet [{#NAME}]: Replicas
item_prototypes.description: The number of replicas per ReplicaSet.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] ReplicaSet [{#NAME}]: Desired replicas
item_prototypes.description: Number of desired pods for a ReplicaSet.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] ReplicaSet [{#NAME}]: Replicas mismatched
item_prototypes.description: The number of ready replicas not matching the desired number of replicas.

trigger_prototypes.expression:
min(/Kubernetes cluster state by HTTP/kube.replicaset.replicas_mismatched[{#NAMESPACE}/{#NAME}],{$KUBE.REPLICA.MISMATCH.EVAL_PERIOD:"replicaset:{#NAMESPACE}:{#NAME}"})>0
and last(/Kubernetes cluster state by HTTP/kube.replicaset.replicas_desired[{#NAMESPACE}/{#NAME}])>=0
and last(/Kubernetes cluster state by HTTP/kube.replicaset.ready[{#NAMESPACE}/{#NAME}])>=0
trigger_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] RS [{#NAME}]: ReplicaSet mismatch
trigger_prototypes.description: ReplicaSet has not matched the expected number of replicas during the specified trigger evaluation period.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] StatefulSet [{#NAME}]: Replicas
item_prototypes.description: The number of replicas per StatefulSet.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] StatefulSet [{#NAME}]: Current replicas
item_prototypes.description: The number of current replicas per StatefulSet.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] StatefulSet [{#NAME}]: Desired replicas
item_prototypes.description: Number of desired pods for a StatefulSet.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] StatefulSet [{#NAME}]: Replicas mismatched
item_prototypes.description: The number of ready replicas not matching the number of replicas.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] StatefulSet [{#NAME}]: Ready replicas
item_prototypes.description: The number of ready replicas per StatefulSet.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] StatefulSet [{#NAME}]: Updated replicas
item_prototypes.description: The number of updated replicas per StatefulSet.

trigger_prototypes.expression: (last(/Kubernetes cluster state by HTTP/kube.statefulset.replicas_ready[{#NAMESPACE}/{#NAME}]) / last(/Kubernetes cluster state by HTTP/kube.statefulset.replicas_current[{#NAMESPACE}/{#NAME}]))<>1
trigger_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] StatefulSet [{#NAME}]: StatefulSet is down

trigger_prototypes.expression:
min(/Kubernetes cluster state by HTTP/kube.statefulset.replicas_mismatched[{#NAMESPACE}/{#NAME}],{$KUBE.REPLICA.MISMATCH.EVAL_PERIOD:"statefulset:{#NAMESPACE}:{#NAME}"})>0
and last(/Kubernetes cluster state by HTTP/kube.statefulset.replicas[{#NAMESPACE}/{#NAME}])>=0
and last(/Kubernetes cluster state by HTTP/kube.statefulset.replicas_ready[{#NAMESPACE}/{#NAME}])>=0
trigger_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] StatefulSet [{#NAME}]: StatefulSet replicas mismatch
trigger_prototypes.description: StatefulSet has not matched the number of replicas during the specified trigger evaluation period.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Build [{#NAME}]: Created
item_prototypes.description: OpenShift Build Unix creation timestamp.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Build [{#NAME}]: Generation
item_prototypes.description: Sequence number representing a specific generation of the desired state.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Build [{#NAME}]: Status phase
item_prototypes.description: The Build phase.

parameters: return ['complete', 'cancelled', 'new', 'pending', 'running', 'failed', 'error'].indexOf(value) + 1 || 'Problem with status processing in JS, no such build status: ' + value;

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] BuildConfig [{#NAME}]: Created
item_prototypes.description: OpenShift BuildConfig Unix creation timestamp.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] BuildConfig [{#NAME}]: Generation
item_prototypes.description: Sequence number representing a specific generation of the desired state.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] BuildConfig [{#NAME}]: Latest version
item_prototypes.description: The latest version of BuildConfig.

item_prototypes.name: Quota [{#NAME}] Resource [{#RESOURCE}]: Type [{#TYPE}]]
item_prototypes.description: Usage about resource quota.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Route [{#NAME}]: Created
item_prototypes.description: OpenShift Route Unix creation timestamp.

item_prototypes.name: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Route [{#NAME}]: Status
item_prototypes.description: Information about route status.

trigger_prototypes.name: Route [{#NAME}] with issue: Status is false

macros.description: Kubernetes API componentstatuses endpoint /api/v1/componentstatuses
Kubernetes API livez endpoint /livez
Kubernetes API readyz endpoint /readyz
Service account bearer token.
Kubernetes API endpoint URL in the format <scheme>://<host>:<port>
Kubernetes API servers metrics endpoint port. Used in ControlPlane LLD.
Kubernetes API servers metrics endpoint scheme. Used in ControlPlane LLD.
Kubernetes Controller manager metrics endpoint port. Used in ControlPlane LLD.
Kubernetes Controller manager metrics endpoint scheme. Used in ControlPlane LLD.
Taint that applies to control plane nodes. Change if needed. Used in ControlPlane LLD.
Sets the HTTP proxy to `http_proxy` value. If this parameter is empty, then no proxy is used.
Node annotations to filter Kubelets (regex in values are supported). See the template's README.md for details.
Node labels to filter Kubelets (regex in values are supported). See the template's README.md for details.
Kubernetes Kubelet metrics endpoint port. Used in Kubelet LLD.
Kubernetes Kubelet metrics endpoint scheme. Used in Kubelet LLD.
Filter of discoverable Kubelets by nodename.
Filter to exclude discovered Kubelets by nodename.
Filter of discoverable metrics by namespace.
Filter to exclude discovered metrics by namespace.
Filter of discoverable nodes by nodename.
Filter to exclude discovered nodes by nodename.
Filter of discoverable persistent volumes by name.
Filter to exclude discovered persistent volumes by name.
The evaluation period range which is used for calculation of expressions in trigger prototypes (time period or value range). Can be used with context.
Kubernetes Scheduler metrics endpoint port. Used in ControlPlane LLD.
Kubernetes Scheduler metrics endpoint scheme. Used in ControlPlane LLD.
Kubernetes state endpoint name.
OpenShift state endpoint name.
